basic_datapoints.introduction: Even as the chorus around  the mandatory linking of Aadhaar with PAN card and bank account, there are a lot of rules that remain unclear. Find how much you know about Aadhaar.

questions.question: What is the maximum charge for Aadhaar services?

options.fact: Correct answer.
Wrong answer. An update of either biometric or demographic details requires the Aadhaar card holder to pay Rs 25
Wrong answer. An update of either biometric or demographic details requires the Aadhaar card holder to pay Rs 26
Wrong answer. An update of either biometric or demographic details requires the Aadhaar card holder to pay Rs 27

questions.question: When was the concept of unique identity first discussed?

options.fact: Wrong answer. The concept of unique identity was first discussed in 2006 during the approval for the project “Unique ID” for BPL families.
Wrong answer. The concept of unique identity was first discussed in 2006 during the approval for the project “Unique ID” for BPL families.
Correct answer.
Wrong answer. The concept of unique identity was first discussed in 2006 during the approval for the project “Unique ID” for BPL families.

questions.question: Aadhaar card has the following details:

options.fact: Wrong answer. Aadhaar card has demographic as well as biometric data of an individual.
Wrong answer. Aadhaar card has demographic as well as biometric data of an individual.
Correct answer.

questions.question: Benefits under the Aadhaar-enabled schemes can be denied to an individual if he/she does not have Aadhaar.

options.fact: Wrong answer. Section 7 of the Aadhaar Act states that if subsidy is given from Consolidated Fund of India then beneficiary must have Aadhaar. If they do not, then they must enroll for Aadhaar and until then alternative means of identification can be used.
Correct answer.

questions.question: You can cast a vote using Aadhaar.

options.fact: Wrong answer. Voter ID is mandatory for casting a vote. One cannot vote using Aadhaar.
Correct answer.
Wrong answer. Voter ID is mandatory for casting a vote. One cannot vote using Aadhaar.

questions.question: Recently, Aadhaar was challenged in Supreme Court because it violated this Right.

options.fact: Correct answer.
Wrong answer. On July 12, the Supreme Court agreed to hear all the issues arising out of Aadhar card, especially the concern over whether it breaches the people's right to privacy.
Wrong answer. On July 12, the Supreme Court agreed to hear all the issues arising out of Aadhar card, especially the concern over whether it breaches the people's right to privacy.
Wrong answer. On July 12, the Supreme Court agreed to hear all the issues arising out of Aadhar card, especially the concern over whether it breaches the people's right to privacy.

questions.question: Government officials can rightfully use Aadhaar to track an individual.

options.fact: Wrong answer. No one can track an individual using Aadhaar. Any such attempt, is an offence under the Aadhaar Act.
Correct answer.

questions.question: What is the tagline for Aadhaar?

options.fact: Correct answer.
Wrong answer. In 2016, the tagline ‘Aam Admi ka Adhikar’ was changed to ‘Mera Aadhaar, Meri Pehchaan’ following several requests to remove the phrase ‘aam admi’.

options.option: Aadhaar is Right of a Common Man
options.fact: Wrong answer. In 2016, the tagline ‘Aam Admi ka Adhikar’ was changed to ‘Mera Aadhaar, Meri Pehchaan’ following several requests to remove the phrase ‘aam admi’.
Wrong answer. In 2016, the tagline ‘Aam Admi ka Adhikar’ was changed to ‘Mera Aadhaar, Meri Pehchaan’ following several requests to remove the phrase ‘aam admi’.
